title.narrative: Protection for victims of forced displacement and confinement in times of COVID-19.

description.narrative: The main aim of this $743,151 UNHCR project is provision of protection mechanisms for IDPs and others at risk as well as reducing the protection gaps related to SGBV. Among key activities UNHCR will equip 8 community infrastructures for IDPs with shelter material and energy sources, install 20 refugee housing units, and train 184 public servants in psychosocial care for IDPs, provide 1450 humanitarian kits to 5,800 beneficiaries, and support 340 SGBV survivors with case management. In total, UNHCR aims to reach 17,954 persons, including 4,938 women and 3,133 girls (and including 179 persons with disabilities).

participating-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Protection for victims of forced displacement and confinement in times of COVID-19.

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Protection through rehabilitation/ equipment of community infrastructures is provided
# of community infrastructures for the protection of displaced persons installed and equipped (budget lines 17, 19, 20 and 21 17 and 19 refer to the same institution as well as 20 and 21).
# of RHUs installed in the prioritized regions in Nariño

# of shelter whose purpose it is to provide safeguard to internally displaced persons of the Mayor’s Offices of Roberto Payán, Magüí Payán, Barbacoas and Pasto as well as properties of ethnic organizations such as Llorente in Tumaco (Nariño) equipped with alternative energy sources (this corresponds to budget line 21, 4 of the 7 institutions will be equipped with solar panels)
Internally displaced persons and others affected by the armed conflict benefit from improved and effective institutional care and optimized protection pathways

# of public servants of the public ministry and public servants directly working with victims of the armed conflict such as representatives of victim’s organizations and the Secretary of State trained regarding reporting and psychosocial care for internally displaced persons
# of contingency and emergency response plans as well as assistance routes elaborated in collaboration with state institutions
5,800 beneficiaries are being provided NFIs and AGD kits for their wellbeing and protection against COVID-19

# of persons receiving 1,450 AGD-specific Humanitarian Aid kits (distributing habitat, hygiene, personal, baby, biosecurity equipment and protection kits) responding to their needs and biosecurity and benefitting approximately 4 beneficiaries per kit
# of women assisted with individual kits adjusted to the needs of women in coordination with corresponding institutions such as the Mayor’s Offices in prioritized regions in Nariño
# of girls and boys assisted through protective plans and the strengthening of educational institutions to mitigate the impact of forced displacement on them
Protection of SGBV survivors and children through rehabilitation/ equipment of infrastructures and the provision of psychological support
# of educational institutions equipped with protective environments for girls and boys strengthened
# of safe spaces for SGBV survivors strengthened (see Activity 4.2)
# of SGBV survivors assisted regarding case management and biosecurity elements as well as psychosocial support provided
